messages.message:
Hi team, I just fired up a new crafting instance as mine seems to have been deleted.  When bringing it up (from ibdev-backend) Workspace dev is failing for python version:
```pip install PyGithub==2.5.0
ERROR: Ignored the following versions that require a different python version: 2.4.0 Requires-Python >=3.8; 2.5.0 Requires-Python >=3.8```
I was following the onboarding guides and I don't remember anything asking me to make sure we had Python 3.9 available.  How do I fix this?
This is on the post-checkout step

Hey there! Can you send the link to your sandbox? I got distracted upgrading our base image after we fully upgraded from python 3.7.3 to 3.7.19 last week, so just need to run a couple commands to get things into a good state on your machine :slightly_smiling_face:
@mfichman would you have any objections to me adding a `pip install PyGithub==2.5.0` to the post-checkout or build hook in the ibdev-backend template?
ideally we'll get a sensible `requirements.txt` that we can install in the docker image for the base snapshot, so this would just be a short term workaround

@Jason your IB services are building now, so the issue you raised is resolved on your host -- the UI will indicate that the sandbox isn't ready yet while the build progresses, however you can access via `cs ssh` / `cs vscode` / "Terminal" button in the UI right away!
